subject: Re: [junit] Exception is swallowed inside tearDown
msgSnippet: ... Aha. Good point. The throw e in the finally {} block does the trick. It took me a little time to see that. -- J. B. Rainsberger, Diaspar Software
messageBody:
Christian Pekeler wrote:

> >> /**
> >> * Runs the bare test sequence.
> >> * This overwrites <code>runBare()</code> in
> >> <code>TestCase</code> such that exceptions in <code>tearDown()</code>
> >> * are only shown if the test itself didn't throw.
> >> */
> >> public void runBare() throws Throwable {
> >> setUp();
> >> try {
> >> runTest();
> >> } catch (Throwable e) {
> >> try {
> >> tearDown();
> >> } finally {
> >> throw e;
> >> }
> >> }
> >> tearDown();
> >> }
> >
> > Do you /really/ want to invoke tearDown() twice?
>
> No. And it doesn't seem to. Do you have a failing testcase that shows
> how this runBare() variation invokes tearDown() twice?

Aha. Good point. The "throw e" in the finally {} block does the trick.
It took me a little time to see that.
--
